adjectives.description: volitional (comparative more volitional, superlative most volitional)

entries.meaning: Of or relating to the volition or will.
examples: Little by little the whole subject population of the world was fitted with the instruments of volitional control. The government was now practically omnipotent.

entries.meaning: Done by conscious, personal choice; not based on external principles; not accidental.
examples: “Loving on” someone—whether he likes it or not—posits love as a volitional activity, an act not of passion but of will.
